description:
The protagonist, Naoya, is a first-year in high school. He asks out Saki, a girl he has been in love with, and she agrees to be his girlfriend. He's currently on cloud nine. But then, a beautiful girl named Nagisa comes up to Naoya one day and tells him that she wants to go out with him. Naoya feels himself wavering because Nagisa is such a good girl, and he comes to a decision! A new kind of romcom from a rather unexpected decision is about to begin!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: จะคนไหนก็แฟนสาว

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Polyamorous
tags.description: Features a character who is in a consenting relationship with multiple people at one time.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description:
[Official Website](http://seijunha.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/burumakun) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/156638) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCILnS0iN-oH8lQAAxscm0PA)


A Japanese mangaka. He is notable for the creation of the four-panel comic strip manga Dōjin Work, which is the first of his works to be adapted into an anime. Hiroyuki is well-known for the creation of many doujinshi based on the Type-Moon visual novels Tsukihime and Fate/stay night. He has won online fame due to his Tsukihime doujins about Len.

His older sister, [Kouji Megumi](https://anilist.co/staff/99669/Kouji-Megumi), is also a manga artist.
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

[Staff Page (Nichion)](https://www.nichionsakka.com/miki-sakurai)

Miki Sakurai was born in 1991 in Miyagi Prefecture. Graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts. She studied composition with Tatsuhiko Nishioka, Yoshihiko Katori, and electronic acoustic music with Takenobu Mori. While studying at university, she began to play Irish music and produce music for art animation. Currently active in various fields, including theater.

**Alma Mater:** Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts (BA Music)

[Website](https://tatsumusic.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsu_saiki) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/tatsuyan)

__Members:__

__[Mossa](https://anilist.co/staff/341209/Mossa)__ (もっさ) - main vocalist, rhythm guitarist, occasional songwriter
- - Utaite on niconico under the name "Higa"
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/higasizumu)

__[Asahi](https://anilist.co/staff/257770/Asahi)__ (朝日) - lead guitarist, songwriter
- __Real Name:__ Ren Asahi
- __Date of Birth:__ July 23, 1990
- Vocaloid producer under the name "Ishifuro"
- Vocalist and guitarist for the band Contemporary na Seikatsu
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ishi_furo)

__Fujita__ (藤田) - bassist
- __Real Name:__ Aya Fujita
- Bassist of the band Contemporary na Seikatsu
- Former member of the band Wagamama College
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/conpolifujita)

__Kazuma Takei__ (カズマ・タケイ) - drummer
- Support member for the band Contemporary na Seikatsu
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chikuika)

__Ikuka Nakamura__ (中村郁香) - keyboardist
- __Real Name:__ Ayaka Nakamura
- __Nickname:__ Mu-san
- Former member of the band gugaguga
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/papaiyayaka)

[Official Website](https://necrytalkie.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Talkie_official)

A Japanese rock band currently associated with Sony Music Entertainment Japan. Formed in 2017 when Ren Asahi invited three other members to form a gig. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

**Height:** 156 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Asakura_Staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeO-6koTkcLNKLFcCiW1SGQ)

Part of the group [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), with fellow voice actresses  [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818) and [Sora Amamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/116517/).

__[Archived Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/426)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://tatsuyatube.blog35.fc2.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsuyakurauchi)__

__Tatsuya Kurauchi__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He previously worked for Smile Company.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__
